Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the extent to which Baringo has exceeded the 35% ceiling on personnel emoluments.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or data to support the assertion that Baringo has gone beyond the 35% ceiling.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that exceeding the 35% ceiling on personnel emoluments is the reason why Baringo cannot meet the workers' pay demands, which may be a problematic assumption.
Falters at times: Some of the claims made by the governor may not withstand scrutiny, indicating that the claim falters at times.
Alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for why Baringo cannot meet the workers' pay demands, such as mismanagement of funds or other financial constraints.
